Meadi Recipe Meadi RECIPE Introduction Recipes89 Food Recommender The Eritrean Food typical meal consists of injera and several kinds of stew. This cuisine consists of vegetables and often very spicy meat dishes. This is usually in the form of sauce served on top of Injera , a large sourdough flatbread which is bout 50 centimeteres (20 inches) in diameter and made out of fremented teff flour. Injera is used to scoop up variety of spicy stews and salads found on ny plate. Habesha people eat with their hands, using pieces of Injera to pick up bites and side dishes. Some of the terms explained: Berbere : is a spice mixture whose constituent elements usually include chili peppers, garlic, ginger, basil, black pepper, rue, fennel flower, and fenugreek. It is a key ingredient in cuisine. You can find this item from any local Eritrean or Ethiopian Store. It is Important to calculate your BMI (Body Mass Index), in order to understand in what kind of food to concentrate more. Eritrean Recipes Menu Here is the list of recipes of the most the common foods eaten by Eritreans: Dinish Eritrean Potato Stew Food Gaat is one of the most common Eritrean breakfast.
